title: Instead of removing every targetted spell, how about making them draw minion aggro
body:
The main reason champs like old Ryze and Vlad and old Cass were/are so stupid to lane against was because of their targetted damage yes, but the main thing is that they could spam spells at you all day and never draw minion aggro, if you tried to fight back as a melee champ then you end up on their side of the lane taking their minion aggro. 

Instead of making targetted spells draw minion aggro like autoattacks, Riot just keeps removing every targetted spell over time lol

replies.body: my favorite part of top lane is when i try to hit the ryze as a melee and then the minions do 600 damage to me. "outplayed" said the ranged champion. thanks riot!

There are some issues with giving Turret AI to minion AI (where the turret will attack enemy champions that damage friendly champions). For example it would significantly hamper DoT champions such as Malzahar. Basically you cast E (Malefic Visions) on the enemy Azir, and now you can't stand near the minions for the duration because they all hate you now (Or if you are Darius, about 50% of the time you can't stand near the minions to last hit because the enemy jax is bleeding). Also instances of collateral damage could be abused as well. For example you could intentionally walk into a mine from the enemy Zigg's minefield and get him swarmed with minions (and goodluck rushing a sunfire cape in toplane).
His suggestion was simply when you cast a targeted spell on an enemy, they take minion agro, like a ryze w or cass e.
Refer back to the Malz E.
Hence the on cast part not on damage..... I thought that was clear.

He means that any ability that involves clicking on your target would draw aggro on cast, similar to Auto attacks, but any damage after the initial damage wouldn't draw aggro. So with Malz E you would draw aggro if you directly casted it on your opponent, but not from it jumping to them, and once you lost aggro the DoT wouldn't draw aggro anymore.
Good points.
Not a bad idea. But I'd like to hear Riot's argument on why they won't do this (because surely they won't).
What makes you say they won't? They might

I think you got it a bit mixed up. Any sort of damage that you do to a champ will aggro enemy minions when you and the opponent are near them. Its similar concept to how towers aggro you except they have a larger range and don't move around like minions. 

Example, GP, MF, Pre-rework Ryze, and Veigar shoots a enemy champ. The poking champ is in his minion wave (meaning in between caster and melee minions), opponent is roughly safe position. That shot dealing the damage will aggro the opposing minions.

What I was trying to get at is that minions tend to fight minions unless aggro'd, and that it is easier for ranged champ to avoid the aggro by being further away from the enemy minions.
